synopsis.text: Kick-Heart tells the tale of two professional wrestlers leading double lives. By day, Romeo Maki runs a rundown orphanage, while Sister Juliet is a timid nun-in-training working there. By night, they become Masked Man M and Lady S - wrestling icons seeking thrills inside the ring. Romeo secretly revels in taking beatings from his opponents. Meanwhile, facing off against challengers makes Juliet feel alive. When these wrestling personas clash, their instant chemistry suggests a destined romance. Yet neither knows the other's true identity. Will Juliet reveal herself to the man she loves? Can Romeo share his hidden desires with the world? With colorful characters and comedic undertones, Kick-Heart explores this unlikely love story set against the backdrop of professional wrestling.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
